subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0092_01C9D9ED.BCE32890
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Ok-found the "Report This Item" link. But there is no option for untrue adv=
ertising. So I guess eBay doesn't think that is a big enough offense.

Some=
one could contact the seller and tell him then they know it isn't true. I d=
on't feel qualified to do so since I only know Frank from this list, and I =
have only been on this list a short time.

It may not do any good, but mayb=
e it will.


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: April Abercrombie 
  T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 8:09 AM
  Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?






  Yes...I kn=
ow.... but it is fun to fantasize. Plus, if I am in a position to make a di=
fference I will. The problem is knowing when or where that position is.

  =
  ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: Kristin Morris 
    To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 7:56 AM
    Subject: RE: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?



    We can't police the=
 entire internet.  People should take responsibility for themselves and do =
some research and find out how this works before they purchase.  

    Cave=
at emptor..  



----------------------------------------------------------=
------------------

    From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com] On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
    Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009=
 8:45 AM
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Eba=
y auction for sorta Frank's Box?







    Exactly! That's what I'm sayin'=
.


    Wouldn't it be a hoot if Frank himself blasted the guy. But that is=
n't the mature way..... ;)


      ----- Original Message ----- 

      Fro=
m: threadsintyme@... 

      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 

      Sent:=
 Thursday, May 21, 2009 5:52 AM

      Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auct=
ion for sorta Frank's Box?


      Why don't some of us respond to his ad..=
.and take serious issue with this business of his lying to the public about=
 Frank? 

      That info is a serious breach of eBay policy. He could be b=
anned from eBay for life. 
      Al
      ---------- Original Message -----=
-----
      From: "Kristin Morris" <ckmorris95@...>
      To: <EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
      Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for so=
rta Frank's Box?
      Date: Thu, 21 May 2009 06:16:27 -0500

      WOW.. F=
rank.  I didn't realize you were charging - and "thousands of dollars" to b=
oot!  Must be to pay for that Faraday Cage and the white noise generator th=
ing this yahoo believes are in all your creations.  And hurry because "his =
supplier" (cough - cough Radio Shack) is discontinuing!  But no worries he =
has "sold over 2 dozen of these 'Frank's Boxes devices" so he must be legit=
 because he knows - and actual customer bought a 'real' Frank's Box and sai=
d it was equal!  Awesome.

      k


--------------------------------------=
------------------------------------

      From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [=
mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of ourobouros2k2
      Sent: Thur=
sday, May 21, 2009 12:50 AM
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
      Subject=
: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?







      Been follo=
wing this unprofessional idiot's items for awhile now. I love how he says t=
hat Frank charges thousands of dollars for an original Frank's box. 

     =
 This dude is the worst type of con, preying on people who know only enough=
 to be familiar with the term Frank's box. Then again, it always has bother=
ed me when people take shack hacks and charge stupid prices for them on eba=
y under the Frank's box moniker.

      This guy is based out of Nevada I b=
elieve, and his group's ethics leave little to be desired. Takes all kinds,=
 I reckon...

      Andy

      --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Aquarius <l=
austin@...> wrote:
      >
      > Hmmm... saw this on Ebay tonight... you'=
ve got to read all the text to hear
      > how he describes what he's sell=
ing. 
      > 
      > Do any of you on this list know who he is? I just th=
ought this was kind of
      > interesting... see:
      > 
      > http://=
tinyurl.com/o5pper
      > 
      > Cheers,
      > 
      > Leslie, consis=
tent lurker and occasional poster <g>
      > 
      > "I'm not happy, I'm =
cheerful. There's a difference. A happy woman has no
      > cares at all. =
A cheerful woman has cares but has learned how to deal with them."
      > =

      > -- Beverly Sills (1929-) American Opera Singer
      >

b Site! Hosting for only $3.95/mo. Free setup!
